model_outputs.question:
In the following sentences, explain the antecedent of the pronoun (which thing the pronoun refers to), or state that it is ambiguous.
Sentence: The patient was referred to the specialist because he had a rare skin condition.
Options:
(A) The patient had a skin condition
(B) The specialist had a skin condition
(C) Ambiguous
model_outputs.model_answer:
The pronoun "he" refers to the patient, since the sentence starts with "the patient was". To explain the antecedent of "he", we need to know what was intended by the author when they used that pronoun. This is ambiguous since "he" could refer to either the patient or the doctor. 

Since "he" is an unidentified antecedent in this case, we cannot determine the correct antecedent without further context. We can be certain that the patient's skin condition was a rare one that required specialist attention. Therefore, the correct answer is (A) The patient had a rare skin condition.
